name: Ubuntu Studio
description: Ubuntu Studio is an officially recognized Ubuntu flavor designed for multimedia production. It comes pre-installed with a suite of tools for audio, video, and graphic design.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Launched in 2007, Ubuntu Studio was created to provide a Linux distribution tailored to creative professionals using free software tools.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Ubuntu Studio gained traction among musicians, video editors, and graphic designers by offering a low-latency kernel and a broad selection of creative applications like Ardour, Blender, and GIMP.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Ubuntu Studio is maintained by a dedicated community and uses KDE Plasma as its desktop environment, with a focus on performance and artistic workflows.

sections.title: Multimedia Focus
sections.text: With a real-time kernel option and creative applications pre-configured, Ubuntu Studio is ideal for digital artists, musicians, and content creators seeking an open-source workstation.
